rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the constitution of casein
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: For many years casein was believed to be a homogenous protein. However, early work with fractional precipitation methods showed that casein was not a single protein, and later, electrophoretic studies proved conclusively that casein is composed or at least three tractions. The tractions were designated as alpha-, beta- and gamma-casein. The physical properties and the composition or the three tractions have been investigated in some detail, but there has been much controversy as to the presence or carbohydrate in casein.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry
